physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 140/85 mm Hg; Temperature: 38.3 Â°C
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General physical examination was unremarkable. Neurologic examination revealed bilateral facial weakness, dysarthria, dysphagia, pyramidal right-sided weakness, and bilateral Babinski signs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The clinical symptoms resolved gradually and spontaneously, with complete recovery 6 hours after presentation.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient had gait difficulties, weakness in both feet, pes cavus, hammertoes, distal muscle wasting, and no knee or ankle reflexes. Sensory examination revealed impaired joint position and vibration sense in both feet.
Mother exhibited pes cavus, hammertoes, diminished knee reflexes, no ankle reflexes, and reduced vibration sense in both legs.
